title: Staff members with no permission can access to the files, uploaded by the administrator

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Our team is busy triaging and fixing HackerOne reports, and it may take us up to 1 week (or more) to triage any given issue. Don't worry, we'll get to yours!

While you are waiting, you can read over our list of non applicable issues listed on our program page: https://hackerone.com/shopify. Make sure your issue isn't listed!
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Our team is busy triaging and fixing HackerOne reports, and it may take us up to 1 week (or more) to triage any given issue. Don't worry, we'll get to yours!

While you are waiting, you can read over our list of non applicable issues listed on our program page: https://hackerone.com/shopify. Make sure your issue isn't listed!

activities.message: Uploading files and images is part of the Product publication functionality. You can see this feature at work by clicking on the "image icon" in the toolbar in the Product screen.
activities.markdown_message: Uploading files and images is part of the Product publication functionality. You can see this feature at work by clicking on the "image icon" in the toolbar in the Product screen.

activities.message: I do understand that. But, if Iam a staff member with NO access to upload images, I even have no access to the product, I still can access to the files uploaded by the owner of the shop.
activities.markdown_message: I do understand that. But, if Iam a staff member with NO access to upload images, I even have no access to the product, I still can access to the files uploaded by the owner of the shop.

activities.message: In test #2 I've showed that.
activities.markdown_message: In test #2 I've showed that.

activities.message:
> iif Iam a staff member with NO access to upload images

There is no way to restrict the upload of images.
activities.markdown_message:
iif Iam a staff member with NO access to upload images

There is no way to restrict the upload of images.

activities.message: Why not. I can't access to the section Settings, but I can upload files in the section settings, is that right?. By the way, I can download all the files there, not even images (if they were uploaded earlier by owner), even if I have no access to the settings section.
activities.markdown_message: Why not. I can't access to the section Settings, but I can upload files in the section settings, is that right?. By the way, I can download all the files there, not even images (if they were uploaded earlier by owner), even if I have no access to the settings section.

activities.message: After discussing it internally, it looks like there is indeed a missing permission check for some of the file upload features, like your test #2 suggests.
activities.markdown_message: After discussing it internally, it looks like there is indeed a missing permission check for some of the file upload features, like your test #2 suggests.

activities.message:
> I can download all the files there, not even images

All the files on the CDN are public by design, so the ability to download or view files is not a vulnerability here.
activities.markdown_message:
I can download all the files there, not even images

All the files on the CDN are public by design, so the ability to download or view files is not a vulnerability here.

activities.message: As you said, probably a permission check error. I know, that the files are public. Possible to get the list of files of the specified shop (even, which are not publised, I think, dind't tried that).
activities.markdown_message: As you said, probably a permission check error. I know, that the files are public. Possible to get the list of files of the specified shop (even, which are not publised, I think, dind't tried that).

activities.message:
By the way, by Description -> Insert image can be uploaded some files which are not tested for the maintenance of some code included eg:
https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/target.swf
activities.markdown_message:
By the way, by Description -> Insert image can be uploaded some files which are not tested for the maintenance of some code included eg:
https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/target.swf

activities.message: There is no security issue with uploading a swf file to the content delivery network.
activities.markdown_message: There is no security issue with uploading a swf file to the content delivery network.

activities.message:
Excuse me, I ask the last silly question regarding uploading files.
Uploaded files on public can be used in conjunction eg:
1-st uploaded file - https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/jquery-2.1.4.js
2-nd uploaded file, with the execution js https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/jq1.html 
Should it be like that?
activities.markdown_message:
Excuse me, I ask the last silly question regarding uploading files.
Uploaded files on public can be used in conjunction eg:
1-st uploaded file - https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/jquery-2.1.4.js
2-nd uploaded file, with the execution js https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/1046/9808/files/jq1.html
Should it be like that?

activities.message: Yes, this is perfectly normal and not a security issue.
activities.markdown_message: Yes, this is perfectly normal and not a security issue.

activities.message: Ok. Thanks for the explanation.
activities.markdown_message: Ok. Thanks for the explanation.

activities.message:
Thanks again for your report. We recently deployed a fix for this issue, and access to rich text editor functionality (including the list of uploaded files) is restricted to staff members having the "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages" permissions.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we will be in touch with you again soon.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks again for your report. We recently deployed a fix for this issue, and access to rich text editor functionality (including the list of uploaded files) is restricted to staff members having the "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages" permissions.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we will be in touch with you again soon.

activities.message:
Hello, nice news )
As you wrote:
"access to rich text editor functionality (including the list of uploaded files) is restricted to staff members having the "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages" permissions".

I tried that:
1) Created shop
2) Added staff member and gave permissions to staff member for "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages"
3) Logged in by staff member 
4) [https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets](https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets)
5) I can see all the files uploaded by admin (attch)

*I think that's a normal way to use this functionality. I may be mistaken...*

The bug was opened for NO permissions members, according Test #2 (in the top).
Tested that. Yes it's fixed.
Can not open page [https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets](https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets) and can not see files.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello, nice news )
As you wrote:
"access to rich text editor functionality (including the list of uploaded files) is restricted to staff members having the "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages" permissions".

I tried that:
1) Created shop
2) Added staff member and gave permissions to staff member for "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages"
3) Logged in by staff member
4) https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets
5) I can see all the files uploaded by admin (attch)

I think that's a normal way to use this functionality. I may be mistaken...

The bug was opened for NO permissions members, according Test #2 (in the top).
Tested that. Yes it's fixed.
Can not open page https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets and can not see files.

activities.message:
> gave permissions to staff member for "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages"
> I can see all the files uploaded by admin (attch)

That is the expected behaviour, as users with those permissions can attach existing uploaded files using the rich text editor.
activities.markdown_message:
gave permissions to staff member for "Products, Inventory, & Collections" or "Blog Posts & Pages"
I can see all the files uploaded by admin (attch)

That is the expected behaviour, as users with those permissions can attach existing uploaded files using the rich text editor.

activities.message: Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify. This issue has been resolved.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify. This issue has been resolved.

activities.markdown_message: Thank you for the reward!

vulnerability_information_html:
Staff members with no permission can access to the files, uploaded by the administrator

Test #1

If the member has access only to the section Products, Inventory, & Collections

  1. Go to the Products -> Product Name -> Description
  2. Click the button -> Add Image
  3. In the section Uploaded images are all files uploded by the admin, so we can simply add them or download (screenshot attached)
  4. Uploded images are in the section Settings -> Files (but we don't have access there)

Test #2

If the member has NO access to the ALL sections

  1. So we can not go to the page Products but....
  2. Lets go here https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets
  3. And we will see all files uploaded by admin (screenshot attached)
  4. On this page we can simply find links for admin files
vulnerability_information:
Staff members with no permission can access to the files, uploaded by the administrator

### Test #1 
If the member has access only to the section  Products, Inventory, & Collections
1. Go to the Products -> Product Name -> Description
2. Click the button -> Add Image
3. In the section Uploaded images are all files uploded by the admin, so we can simply add them or download (screenshot attached)
4. Uploded images are in the section Settings -> Files (but we don't have access there)

### Test #2
If the member has NO access to the ALL sections
1. So we can not go to the page Products but....
2. Lets go here https://*.myshopify.com/admin/rte/assets
3. And we will see all files uploaded by admin (screenshot attached)
4. On this page we can simply find links for admin files
